page.title: 01HISTORY-WELWYN GARDEN CITY
page.content: Welwyn Garden City was the idea of Ebenezer Howard. He wanted to improve living standards for the not so rich and the new town was designed to make the best use possible of landscaping. The architect was a man called Louis de Soissons, and preparation began in 1919 although the town's birthdate is actually 1920. Ebenezer Howard was born in the City of London on the 29th of January, 1850, he was one of four surviving children out of nine. In 1865 he moved to America to try and make something of his life. Ebenezer returned to England in 1876, and it was his second wife who gave him all the drive and moral support to carry on his work with new towns. The town was planned so that the industrial area was set apart, and some of the first houses can still be seen around the Handside Lane area.
